content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  October 17 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB' rating to Aflac  Inc.'s (Aflac) proposed issuance of 2.108% JPY60 billion subordinated notes due 2047. KEY RATING DRIVERS The rating for the new offering is equivalent to the rating on Aflac's existing subordinated debt. The notes are rated three notches below the company's 'A' Insurer Default Rating (IDR)  which reflects Fitch's assumption of "poor" recovery prospects in th
name: Aflac Incorporated
title: Fitch Rates Aflac Inc.'s JPY60 Billion Subordinated Debt 'BBB'

content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  May 02 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Aflac Inc.'s (Aflac) primary life insurance subsidiaries' Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) ratings at 'A+' and revised the Outlook to Stable from Negative. Fitch has affirmed Aflac's Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'A' and senior debt ratings at 'A-'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. A full list of rating actions follows at the end of this release. KEY RATING DRIVERS Today's actions follow
name: Aflac Incorporated
title: Fitch Affirms Aflac's Ratings; Revises IFS Outlook to Stable

(Aflac). The 'A-' rating is equivalent to Fitch's ratings on Aflac's outstanding  senior unsecured notes. content: May 10 Wall Street securities analysts revised their ratings and price targets on several U.S.-listed companies  including Your Community Bankshares  Kohls and Nordic American Tanker  on Tuesday.            HIGHLIGHTS      * Aflac Inc        : FBR cuts to market perform rating        * Sprouts Farmers market Inc        : Goldman Sachs cuts to sell from neutral        * Hasbro Inc        : Piper Jaffray cuts to neutral from overweight           * St. Jude Medical Inc        : SunTrust

title: U.S. RESEARCH ROUNDUP-Aflac  St. Jude Medical  Gap

content: WASHINGTON The U.S. Federal Communications Commission said late on Tuesday it had approved European telecoms group Altice NV's acquisition of U.S. cable company Cablevision Systems Corp in a $17.7 billion deal that includes assumption of debt.
name: Aflac Incorporated
title: U.S. FCC approves Altice purchase of Cablevision Systems
